reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA few game breaking issues one being if you die it causes game to crash, I can't seem to get resolution to 1920x1080 without user interface breaking in some way i think these desperately need to be fixed and more intuitive control system is needed. reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Rogue-like RPGhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bA_VVWYnaYg
This is a pretty bare-bones game that operated on a turn system grid

+ You don't lose progress if you die

This game is in Early Access so don't take these points too seriously
- It's hard to tell what you are supposed to do at the beginning or where you are supposed to be going, the only thing that is mentioned is if you make it through the dungeon you will get to the village.
- The combat is pretty awful, it's mainly just running into an enemy (literally), scratching your head, and then maybe you die? It's hard to understand what is happening during these combat scenerios.
- The User Interface is overly cluttered and small, making it hard to understand the information that is shown
- While I understand that you are supposed to find chests to get better gear, and loot enemies...you often die in the most obscure of ways that often don't really give you a good understanding of what happened or how to prevent it.

I may come back to this game in a few months but at the moment I just could not find much to like about this game.

Let me get some complaints out that hopefully the dev will respond to eventually.

A pretty shoddy roguelike with very little to recommend it. There are plenty of good games in the genre out there, so there is no reason to waste time and money on this one.

As best as I have been able to determine (see more about the many impediments to actually trying to play the game below), this is a very generic and simplistic roguelike"/action rpg-style game with some feeble attempts at humor thrown in. The game being in Early Access

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Family of Grave digger is a 16-bit rogue-like/action rpg-style game.

There isn't a story behind this game and it seems your main objective is to explore, fight, survive and discover new areas.

Tha main character is well defined but, in general, graphics are very pixelized and the different areas are made using big squeared tiles.

The guy is easy to control using four arrows and spacebar or using a mouse to move, make actions or combat enemies (just need to click on them to kill them)

I was killed very fast and sometimes, I didn't know why, but in other cases I was poisoned by a snake in the second fight. In my opinion this is not a well balanced game.

Typical inventory management, and a lot of different objects and potions to collect from chests and defeated enemies. In this case, the inventory and statistics are shown on the screen in different areas that you can change of position. You can press F1 to show a contextual help.

Music is a little bit annoying and sounds are nonexixtent.

The map is not complex but i miss the little map of the area in the corner of the screen or a big one when you press M key.

The game has achievements but it has not trading cards. I encourage to developers to add them in next releases.

I don't understand so well why an early acces game that shows this message Beta 0.74" in the middle of the screen wants that somebody pay ten bucks for it.

Sorry but there are alot of games better and cheaper than this to play more than an hour.

PS: Thanks to Shade00"
